Dear Stefan Schulze,
=A0
there is no Hashset in my code. How could you figu=

--- =
On Wed, 8/6/08, Stefan Schulze <algroth@...> wrote:

From: Stefan Schulz=
e <algroth@...>
Subject: RE: [junit] Anyone help me to figure out the ja=
va.lang.StackOverflowError problem?
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Date: Wednesd=
ay, August 6, 2008, 7:34 AM






Hi Fuguo,

some days ago I nearly went cr=
azy with a bug in my software, which only
occured in some JUnit-tests. Afte=
r spending lots of time it turned out to be
caused by iterating over a Hash=
Set. I wrongly thought the order doesn't
matter I used the HashSet. Additio=
nally I didn't override the
hashCode()-function s. This causes my program t=
o iterate sometimes (usually
when I run as JUnit-test but quite never when =
I run with a debugger and
breakpoints - I guess it has something to do with=
 the hashcodes depending on
the allocated memory) in another order.
So the =
assumption that the order of iteration doesn't matter was wrong and
this ca=
uses the failure.

Possibly it's somehow similar to your problem...

 




=
